symptoms.name: Diplopia
symptoms.pattern: Three weeks duration, paresis of left cranial nerve III

symptoms.name: Painful vesicular rash
symptoms.pattern: Localized to second sacral dermatome of right leg

physical_findings: Crusted lesions following the second sacral dermatome on the posterior right leg extending from the sacral region to the lower calf
Difficulty with ambulation without any focal deficits
Paresis of the III left cranial nerve (in one case)

lab_values.cerebrospinal_fluid_cell_count: Lymphocytic pleocytosis (37 cells, 88% lymphocytes in one case)

risk_factors: Poor adherence to antiretroviral therapy (in one case)

imaging_findings.brain_CT: Chronic mild to moderate degenerative changes
brain_MRI: Abnormal appearance of the distal left vertebral artery
Three hyperintense T2-weighted lesions surrounded by edema in the right sublenticular, left occipital and left parietal regions (in one case)

Small nodular lesion in the right sublenticular region with hyperintense signal on the axial T2-weighted image and homogeneous enhancement on the axial T1-weighted image after gadolinium, surrounded by edema (in one case)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with encephalitis (e.g., altered mental status, hallucinations, weakness)
supportive: Lymphocytic pleocytosis and elevated protein in CSF
Characteristic imaging findings on brain MRI
